title: Bug 49195: Error message printed when shutdown port 1 is used with Windows service
description: When the <Server port="1"/> is specified in the server.xml, Tomcat can be stopped through an OS signal or using Catalina.stop(). However, in this case, an error message is printed. It is also possible that the behavior is the same when using jsvc, although it has not been tested.
OB: When running Tomcat as a Windows service and specifying <Server port="1"/>, stopping the service or shutting down the server through an OS signal causes an error message to be printed.
EB: When running Tomcat as a Windows service and specifying <Server port="1"/>, stopping the service or shutting down the server through an OS signal should not produce an error message.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 

1. Install Tomcat as a service on Windows. 
2. Start the service. 
3. Stop the service. 
4. Shut down the server through an OS signal or by calling Catalina.stop().
